div.p: Kindergarten Registration | HTPS Handouts | 2019-2020 Student-Parent Handbook | COVID-19 Plan

p.i: The Elementary School office is currently closed, so kindergarten registration will resume when the office reopens. Please click
to answer a few questions so that we can contact you when we reopen. If you have any questions, please email the principal at

p.a: Hardyston Schools will be closed from March 16 – May 15 | Click here for more info

img.alt: Stay tuned for our first edition of the Hardyston Weekly announcements, coming out Monday. The first week's activity is "pets doing schoolwork" so here's a sneak peek. Hope to see your pictures next week!
New bleachers outside the MS locker rooms! Thank you Littell Center for donating them and a big thank you to Mr. Platvoet, Mr. Tully, & Mr. Gunderman for installing them. They look great!
Mrs. Healy's 3rd grade class project, “One Word 2020,” gave residents at the Westwind Manor some inspiration this holiday season. ❤️
Missing everyone!
Our own Mr. Platvoet making a special donation of gloves to Atlantic Health 👍🙏
Thank you to Isobel Costello, Franklin Weis, and the Weekend Bag program for food and awesome Easter treats. 🙏🐰
Be smart. Be safe.
We are apart, but in this together!
If you come to the Middle School, don't forget to... 👍💪
Don't forget to take care of your own needs
Hardyston student making masks for nurses in NYC, CA & CO. Great example of being positive, productive, and helping others less fortunate. 🙏
One of the STEM choice activities this week is to make a parachute. Check out this video submitted from a 7th grader testing it out the bedroom window!!! 👍
Programming a COSMO Robot with an iPhone. Great STEM activity- remote learning at its finest!
Remote Learning with Mrs. Guarino! Using Google Hangouts for full teacher engagement. Awesome...
Learning at home has its benefits 😉

Hardyston Elementary School's Girls Who Code club had a very special visitor on Thursday, March 12. Mrs. Tanya Busayadilok, Self Defenses System Engineering Branch Chief at Picatinny Arsenal spoke to the girls about coding, engineering and the project she works on for the US Navy. The girls are pictured with Mrs. Ploch, Girls Who Code advisor (left) and Mrs. Busayadilok (right).
"The more that you read, the more things you will know, the more that you learn, the more places you’ll go.”– Dr. Seuss
Hardyston Schools are closed March 16-27. Please visit www.htps.org for Remote Learning Plans (RLP).
IT 101
Middle school cafeteria-Be good to each other

div.p: Lead Water Testing Results | Middle School | Elementary School
